content: 1 The word of Yahweh which came unto Micah the Morashtite, in the days of Jotham､ Ahaz､ Hezekiah､ kings of Judah,—of which he had vision concerning Samaria､ and Jerusalem:—
content_old: 1 The word of Yahweh which came unto Micah the Morashtite, in the days of Jotham､ Ahaz､ Hezekiah､ kings of Judah,—of which he had vision concerning Samaria､ and Jerusalem:—

content: 2 Hear､ ye peoples all of you Hearken､ O earth and the fulness thereof,— And let My Lord Yahweh be among you for a witness, My Lord out of his holy temple.
content_old: 2 Hear､ ye peoples all of you Hearken､ O earth and the fulness thereof,— And let My Lord Yahweh be among you for a witness, My Lord out of his holy temple.

content: 3 For lo! Yahweh coming forth out of his place,— That he may descend､ and march along upon the high places of the earth.
content_old: 3 For lo! Yahweh coming forth out of his place,— That he may descend､ and march along upon the high places of the earth.

content: 4 Then shall the mountains be melted beneath him, And the valleys be cleft,— As wax before the fire, As waters poured out in a steep place.
content_old: 4 Then shall the mountains be melted beneath him, And the valleys be cleft,— As wax before the fire, As waters poured out in a steep place.

content: 5 For the transgression of Jacob is all this, And for the sin of the house of Israel,— Whose is the transgression of Jacob? Is it not Samaria’s? And whose is the sin of Judah? Is it not Jerusalem’s?
content_old: 5 For the transgression of Jacob is all this, And for the sin of the house of Israel,— Whose is the transgression of Jacob? Is it not Samaria’s? And whose is the sin of Judah? Is it not Jerusalem’s?

content: 6 Therefore will I make of Samaria A heap in a field､ The plantings in a vineyard,— And I will pour down､ into the valley､ her stones, And her foundations will I lay bare;
content_old: 6 Therefore will I make of Samaria A heap in a field､ The plantings in a vineyard,— And I will pour down､ into the valley､ her stones, And her foundations will I lay bare;

content: 7 And all her images shall be beaten in pieces､ And all her rewards for unchastity shall be burned in the fire, And all her idols will I make a desolation,— For out of the reward of Unchastity she gathered them, And unto the reward of unchastity shall they return.
content_old: 7 And all her images shall be beaten in pieces､ And all her rewards for unchastity shall be burned in the fire, And all her idols will I make a desolation,— For out of the reward of Unchastity she gathered them, And unto the reward of unchastity shall they return.

content: 8 For this cause will I lament and howl, I will go stript and bare,— I will make a lamentation､ like the wild dogs, And a mourning､ like ostriches.
content_old: 8 For this cause will I lament and howl, I will go stript and bare,— I will make a lamentation､ like the wild dogs, And a mourning､ like ostriches.

content: 9 For dangerous’ are her wounds,— For she hath come as far as Judah, She hath reached as far as the gate of my people､ as far as Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 For dangerous’ are her wounds,— For she hath come as far as Judah, She hath reached as far as the gate of my people､ as far as Jerusalem.

content: 10 In Gath do not tell, In Accho do not weep,— In Beth-l’aphrah roll yourselves in dust.
content_old: 10 In Gath do not tell, In Accho do not weep,— In Beth-l’aphrah roll yourselves in dust.

content: 11 Pass thou over (for you)､ thou inhabitress of Shaphir､ of disgraceful disclosure,— The inhabitress of Zaanan hath not gone forth, At the lamentation of Beth-ezel shall he take from you his station,
content_old: 11 Pass thou over (for you)､ thou inhabitress of Shaphir､ of disgraceful disclosure,— The inhabitress of Zaanan hath not gone forth, At the lamentation of Beth-ezel shall he take from you his station,

content: 12 Though the inhabitress of Maroth waited for blessing,— Yet there came down calamity from Yahweh､ to the gate of Jerusalem.
content_old: 12 Though the inhabitress of Maroth waited for blessing,— Yet there came down calamity from Yahweh､ to the gate of Jerusalem.

content: 13 Bind the chariot to the steed､ O inhabitress of Lachish,— The beginning of sin was she to the daughter of Zion, For in thee have been found the transgressions of Israel.
content_old: 13 Bind the chariot to the steed､ O inhabitress of Lachish,— The beginning of sin was she to the daughter of Zion, For in thee have been found the transgressions of Israel.

content: 14 Therefore shalt thou give a dismission, against Moresheth-gath,— The houses of Achzib served for a deception to the kings of Israel.
content_old: 14 Therefore shalt thou give a dismission, against Moresheth-gath,— The houses of Achzib served for a deception to the kings of Israel.

content: 15 The time shall yet be when the heir I will bring unto thee, O inhabitress of Mareshah,— As far as Adullam shall enter the glory of Israel.
content_old: 15 The time shall yet be when the heir I will bring unto thee, O inhabitress of Mareshah,— As far as Adullam shall enter the glory of Israel.

content: 1 Alas for them who devise iniquity and work wickedness upon their beds,— In the light of the morning they will execute it, for it is in the power of their hand.
content_old: 1 Alas for them who devise iniquity and work wickedness upon their beds,— In the light of the morning they will execute it, for it is in the power of their hand.

content: 2 Thus do they covet fields and seize them, And houses and take them away,— And so they oppress the master and his household, the man and his inheritance.
content_old: 2 Thus do they covet fields and seize them, And houses and take them away,— And so they oppress the master and his household, the man and his inheritance.

content: 3 Therefore— Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! devising､ against this family､ a calamity,— From which ye shall not remove your neck､ Neither shall ye walk loftily, For a time of calamity shall it be.
content_old: 3 Therefore— Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! devising､ against this family､ a calamity,— From which ye shall not remove your neck､ Neither shall ye walk loftily, For a time of calamity shall it be.

content: 4 In that day shall one Take up against you a by-word､ And lament a lamentable lamentation､ Saying— We are made utterly desolate, The portion of my people he passeth to others,— How doth he set me aside! To an apostate our fields doth he apportion.
content_old: 4 In that day shall one Take up against you a by-word､ And lament a lamentable lamentation､ Saying— We are made utterly desolate, The portion of my people he passeth to others,— How doth he set me aside! To an apostate our fields doth he apportion.

content: 5 Therefore shalt thou have none to throw a measuring-line by lot,—in the convocation of Yahweh.
content_old: 5 Therefore shalt thou have none to throw a measuring-line by lot,—in the convocation of Yahweh.

content: 6 Do not sputter— So they sputter! They must not sputter as to these things, Must he not put away reproaches?
content_old: 6 Do not sputter— So they sputter! They must not sputter as to these things, Must he not put away reproaches?

content: 7 O thou who art said to be the house of Jacob､ Is the spirit of Yahweh impatient? Or are these his doings? Are not his words pleasant to him who is upright in his walk?
content_old: 7 O thou who art said to be the house of Jacob､ Is the spirit of Yahweh impatient? Or are these his doings? Are not his words pleasant to him who is upright in his walk?

content: 8 But against my people as an enemy he setteth himself, From off the robe they tear away the cloak,— From such as are passing by with confidence, as men averse from war.
content_old: 8 But against my people as an enemy he setteth himself, From off the robe they tear away the cloak,— From such as are passing by with confidence, as men averse from war.

content: 9 The wives of my people ye do even drive out, each from the house of her darlings,— From over her children ye do take away mine ornament､ as long as life shall last.
content_old: 9 The wives of my people ye do even drive out, each from the house of her darlings,— From over her children ye do take away mine ornament､ as long as life shall last.

content: 10 Arise ye and depart, for this is not the place of rest,— Because it is defiled it shall make desolate with a desolation that is ruthless.
content_old: 10 Arise ye and depart, for this is not the place of rest,— Because it is defiled it shall make desolate with a desolation that is ruthless.

content: 11 If there be a man Who goeth after wind､ And falsehood hath woven, saying— I will discourse to thee, concerning wine and strong drink Then shall he become a fountain of discourse unto this people.
content_old: 11 If there be a man Who goeth after wind､ And falsehood hath woven, saying— I will discourse to thee, concerning wine and strong drink Then shall he become a fountain of discourse unto this people.

content: 12 I will surely assemble､ O Jacob､ all of thee, I will surely gather the remnant of Israel, At once will I make them like sheep in distress,— Like a flock in the midst of its pasture shall they hum with men,
content_old: 12 I will surely assemble､ O Jacob､ all of thee, I will surely gather the remnant of Israel, At once will I make them like sheep in distress,— Like a flock in the midst of its pasture shall they hum with men,

content: 1 Then said I､ Hear､ I pray you､ ye heads of Jacob, And ye judges of the house of Israel,— Is it not yours to know justice?
content_old: 1 Then said I､ Hear､ I pray you､ ye heads of Jacob, And ye judges of the house of Israel,— Is it not yours to know justice?

content: 2 Ye haters of right､ and lovers of wrong,— Tearing away their skin from off them, And their flesh from off their bones;
content_old: 2 Ye haters of right､ and lovers of wrong,— Tearing away their skin from off them, And their flesh from off their bones;

content: 3 Who indeed have eaten the flesh of my people, And their skin from off them have stript､ And their bones have they broken in pieces,— And will spread them out､ as flesh with a fork, And as flesh､ in the midst of a pot.
content_old: 3 Who indeed have eaten the flesh of my people, And their skin from off them have stript､ And their bones have they broken in pieces,— And will spread them out､ as flesh with a fork, And as flesh､ in the midst of a pot.

content: 4 Then shall they make outcry unto Yahweh, But he will not answer them,— That he may hide his face from them､ at that time, Even as they have made wicked their doings.
content_old: 4 Then shall they make outcry unto Yahweh, But he will not answer them,— That he may hide his face from them､ at that time, Even as they have made wicked their doings.

content: 5 Thus saith Yahweh, Concerning the prophets who are leading astray my people,— Who bite with their teeth､ and then cry—Prosper! And whoso holdeth not to their mouth they hallow against him a war!
content_old: 5 Thus saith Yahweh, Concerning the prophets who are leading astray my people,— Who bite with their teeth､ and then cry—Prosper! And whoso holdeth not to their mouth they hallow against him a war!

content: 6 Therefore shall it be Night to you､ for lack of vision, And darkness to you､ for lack of divination,— And the sun shall go in over the prophets, And the day shall be overcast because of them;
content_old: 6 Therefore shall it be Night to you､ for lack of vision, And darkness to you､ for lack of divination,— And the sun shall go in over the prophets, And the day shall be overcast because of them;

content: 7 And the men of vision shall turn pale､ And the diviners shall blush, And shall put a covering upon their lip､ all of them,— Because there is no answer of God.
content_old: 7 And the men of vision shall turn pale､ And the diviners shall blush, And shall put a covering upon their lip､ all of them,— Because there is no answer of God.

content: 8 But in very deed I am full of vigour､ With the spirit of Yahweh, And of justice and of valour,— To declare to Jacob､ his transgression, and to Israel, his sin.
content_old: 8 But in very deed I am full of vigour､ With the spirit of Yahweh, And of justice and of valour,— To declare to Jacob､ his transgression, and to Israel, his sin.

content: 9 Hear this､ I pray you, Ye heads of the house of Jacob, and Ye judges of the house of Israel,— Who abhor justice, And all right do pervert:
content_old: 9 Hear this､ I pray you, Ye heads of the house of Jacob, and Ye judges of the house of Israel,— Who abhor justice, And all right do pervert:

content: 10 Building Zion､ with deeds of blood,— And Jerusalem､ with perversity.
content_old: 10 Building Zion､ with deeds of blood,— And Jerusalem､ with perversity.

content: 11 Her heads for a bribe pronounce sentence､ And her priests for a price give direction, And her prophets forsilver divine,— Yet on Yahweh they lean､ saying, Is not Yahweh in our midst? There shall not come upon us､ calamity.
content_old: 11 Her heads for a bribe pronounce sentence､ And her priests for a price give direction, And her prophets forsilver divine,— Yet on Yahweh they lean､ saying, Is not Yahweh in our midst? There shall not come upon us､ calamity.

content: 1 But it shall come to pass in the afterpart of the days That the mountain of the house of Yahweh､ Shall be set up as the head of the mountains, And exalted shall it be､ above the hills, —And peoples shall stream thereunto;
content_old: 1 But it shall come to pass in the afterpart of the days That the mountain of the house of Yahweh､ Shall be set up as the head of the mountains, And exalted shall it be､ above the hills, —And peoples shall stream thereunto;

content: 2 Yea many nations shall go､ and say— Come ye､ and let us ascend Unto the mountain of Yahweh､ and Unto the house of the God of Jacob, That he may teach us of his ways､ And we may walk in his paths,— For out of Zion shall go forth a law, And the word of Yahweh out of Jerusalem;
content_old: 2 Yea many nations shall go､ and say— Come ye､ and let us ascend Unto the mountain of Yahweh､ and Unto the house of the God of Jacob, That he may teach us of his ways､ And we may walk in his paths,— For out of Zion shall go forth a law, And the word of Yahweh out of Jerusalem;

content: 3 And he will judge between many peoples, And be umpire to strong nations far and wide,— And they will beat their swords into ploughshares､ and their spears into pruning-hooks, Nation—against nation—shall not lift up sword､ Neither shall they learn—any more—to make war.
content_old: 3 And he will judge between many peoples, And be umpire to strong nations far and wide,— And they will beat their swords into ploughshares､ and their spears into pruning-hooks, Nation—against nation—shall not lift up sword､ Neither shall they learn—any more—to make war.

content: 4 And they shall dwell—every man— Under his own vine and Under his own fig-tree､ With none to make them afraid,— For the mouth of Yahweh of hosts hath spoken.
content_old: 4 And they shall dwell—every man— Under his own vine and Under his own fig-tree､ With none to make them afraid,— For the mouth of Yahweh of hosts hath spoken.

content: 5 For all the peoples walk､ every man in the name of his god,— We therefore､ will walk in the name of Yahweh our God､ to times age-abiding and beyond.
content_old: 5 For all the peoples walk､ every man in the name of his god,— We therefore､ will walk in the name of Yahweh our God､ to times age-abiding and beyond.

content: 6 In that day Declareth Yahweh､ Will I take up her that is lame, And her that hath been an outcast will I carry,— Even whomsoever I have afflicted;
content_old: 6 In that day Declareth Yahweh､ Will I take up her that is lame, And her that hath been an outcast will I carry,— Even whomsoever I have afflicted;

content: 7 And will make of her that was lame a residue, And of her that was removed far away a strong nation,— And Yahweh shall be king over them､ in Mount Zion, From henceforth､ even unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 7 And will make of her that was lame a residue, And of her that was removed far away a strong nation,— And Yahweh shall be king over them､ in Mount Zion, From henceforth､ even unto times age-abiding.

content: 8 Thou therefore､ O Migdal-eder Mound of the daughter of Zion､ As far as thee shall it come,— So shall arrive the chief dominion, The kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.
content_old: 8 Thou therefore､ O Migdal-eder Mound of the daughter of Zion､ As far as thee shall it come,— So shall arrive the chief dominion, The kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.

content: 9 Meanwhile wherefore shouldst thou cry out aloud? King is there none within thee? Or hath thy counsellor perished? For labour hath seized thee､ as a woman in child-birth:—
content_old: 9 Meanwhile wherefore shouldst thou cry out aloud? King is there none within thee? Or hath thy counsellor perished? For labour hath seized thee､ as a woman in child-birth:—

content: 10 Be in labour､ and bear､ O daughter of Zion､ as a woman in child-birth,— For meanwhile shalt thou go forth out of the city､ And dwell in the field､ And shalt come as far as Babylon､ There shalt thou be delivered, There will Yahweh redeem thee out of the grasp of thine enemies.
content_old: 10 Be in labour､ and bear､ O daughter of Zion､ as a woman in child-birth,— For meanwhile shalt thou go forth out of the city､ And dwell in the field､ And shalt come as far as Babylon､ There shalt thou be delivered, There will Yahweh redeem thee out of the grasp of thine enemies.

content: 11 Meanwhile therefore､ shall be gathered against thee many nations,—Who are saying— Let her be defiled, And let our eyes gaze upon Zion.
content_old: 11 Meanwhile therefore､ shall be gathered against thee many nations,—Who are saying— Let her be defiled, And let our eyes gaze upon Zion.

content: 12 But they know not the purposes of Yahweh, Neither have they discerned his counsel,— For he hath gathered them､ as sheaves､ to a threshing-floor.
content_old: 12 But they know not the purposes of Yahweh, Neither have they discerned his counsel,— For he hath gathered them､ as sheaves､ to a threshing-floor.

content: 1 Meanwhile shalt thou gather together in troops thou daughter of a troop, Siege hath he laid against us,— With a sceptre will they smite on the cheek､ the judge of Israel!
content_old: 1 Meanwhile shalt thou gather together in troops thou daughter of a troop, Siege hath he laid against us,— With a sceptre will they smite on the cheek､ the judge of Israel!

content: 2 Thou therefore､ Bethlehem Ephrathah､ Though little to be among the thousands of Judah Out of thee shall Mine come forth, to be ruler in Israel,— Whose comings forth have been from of old､ from the days of age-past time.
content_old: 2 Thou therefore､ Bethlehem Ephrathah､ Though little to be among the thousands of Judah Out of thee shall Mine come forth, to be ruler in Israel,— Whose comings forth have been from of old､ from the days of age-past time.

content: 3 Therefore will he give them up, Until the time when one who is to bring forth hath brought forth,— And the remainder of his brethren return unto the sons of Israel.
content_old: 3 Therefore will he give them up, Until the time when one who is to bring forth hath brought forth,— And the remainder of his brethren return unto the sons of Israel.

content: 4 Then shall he stand, and tend his flock in the strength of Yahweh, In the excellency of the name of Yahweh his God have they endured,— For now shall he be great unto the ends of the earth;
content_old: 4 Then shall he stand, and tend his flock in the strength of Yahweh, In the excellency of the name of Yahweh his God have they endured,— For now shall he be great unto the ends of the earth;

content: 5 So shall this one be Prosperity. As for Assyria— When he shall enter our land､ and When he shall tread down in our palaces Then will we raise up against him､ Seven shepherds, and Eight princes of mankind.
content_old: 5 So shall this one be Prosperity. As for Assyria— When he shall enter our land､ and When he shall tread down in our palaces Then will we raise up against him､ Seven shepherds, and Eight princes of mankind.

content: 6 Then shall they shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword, And the land of Nimrod in the entrances thereof,— So shall he deliver from Assyria, When he shall enter our land､ and When he shall tread down within our bounds.
content_old: 6 Then shall they shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword, And the land of Nimrod in the entrances thereof,— So shall he deliver from Assyria, When he shall enter our land､ and When he shall tread down within our bounds.

content: 7 And the remnant of Jacob shall be in the midst of many peoples, As dew from Yahweh､ As myriad drops on plants,— Which tarrieth not for man, Nor waiteth for the sons of Adam.
content_old: 7 And the remnant of Jacob shall be in the midst of many peoples, As dew from Yahweh､ As myriad drops on plants,— Which tarrieth not for man, Nor waiteth for the sons of Adam.

content: 8 And the remnant of Jacob shall be Among the nations, In the midst of many peoples, As a lion among the beasts of the jungle, As a young lion among flocks of sheep,— Who if he passeth by Both treadeth down—And teareth in pieces､ And none can deliver.
content_old: 8 And the remnant of Jacob shall be Among the nations, In the midst of many peoples, As a lion among the beasts of the jungle, As a young lion among flocks of sheep,— Who if he passeth by Both treadeth down—And teareth in pieces､ And none can deliver.

content: 9 Let thy hand be uplifted against thine adversaries,— And all thine enemies shall be cut off.
content_old: 9 Let thy hand be uplifted against thine adversaries,— And all thine enemies shall be cut off.

content: 10 And it shall come to pass in that day Declareth Yahweh, That I will cut off thy horses out of thy midst,— And will destroy thy chariots;
content_old: 10 And it shall come to pass in that day Declareth Yahweh, That I will cut off thy horses out of thy midst,— And will destroy thy chariots;

content: 11 And will cut off the cities of thy land,— And will pull down all thy fortresses;
content_old: 11 And will cut off the cities of thy land,— And will pull down all thy fortresses;

content: 12 And will cut off incantations､ out of thy hand,— And users of hidden arts shalt thou not have;
content_old: 12 And will cut off incantations､ out of thy hand,— And users of hidden arts shalt thou not have;

content: 13 And I will cut off thine images and thy pillars､ out of thy midst,— And thou shalt not bow thyself down､ any more､ to the work of thine own hands;
content_old: 13 And I will cut off thine images and thy pillars､ out of thy midst,— And thou shalt not bow thyself down､ any more､ to the work of thine own hands;

content: 14 And I will uproot thy Sacred Stems out of thy midst,— And will destroy thy cities:
content_old: 14 And I will uproot thy Sacred Stems out of thy midst,— And will destroy thy cities:

content: 1 Hear､ I pray you､ what Yahweh is saying,— Arise thou､ maintain thy controversy before the mountains, And let the hills hear thy voice:—
content_old: 1 Hear､ I pray you､ what Yahweh is saying,— Arise thou､ maintain thy controversy before the mountains, And let the hills hear thy voice:—

content: 2 Hear､ ye mountains､ the controversy of Yahweh, And ye lasting rocks､ the foundations of the earth,— For a controversy hath Yahweh､ with his people, And with Israel will he dispute.
content_old: 2 Hear､ ye mountains､ the controversy of Yahweh, And ye lasting rocks､ the foundations of the earth,— For a controversy hath Yahweh､ with his people, And with Israel will he dispute.

content: 3 O my people! what have I done to thee? And wherein have I wearied thee? Testify thou against me!
content_old: 3 O my people! what have I done to thee? And wherein have I wearied thee? Testify thou against me!

content: 4 For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, And out of the house of slaves I ransomed thee,— And I sent before thee､ Moses､ Aaron and Miriam.
content_old: 4 For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, And out of the house of slaves I ransomed thee,— And I sent before thee､ Moses､ Aaron and Miriam.

content: 5 O my people! remember､ I pray you､ What Balak king of Moab counselled, and What Balaam son of Beor answered him,— From the Acacias as far as Gilgal, That ye may know the righteousness of Yahweh.
content_old: 5 O my people! remember､ I pray you､ What Balak king of Moab counselled, and What Balaam son of Beor answered him,— From the Acacias as far as Gilgal, That ye may know the righteousness of Yahweh.

content: 6 Wherewith shall I come before Yahweh? bow myself to God on high? Shall I come before him with ascending-sacrifices? with calves of a year old?
content_old: 6 Wherewith shall I come before Yahweh? bow myself to God on high? Shall I come before him with ascending-sacrifices? with calves of a year old?

content: 7 Will Yahweh be pleased with thousands of rams? with myriads of torrents of oil? Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression? the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
content_old: 7 Will Yahweh be pleased with thousands of rams? with myriads of torrents of oil? Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression? the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

content: 8 He hath told thee､ O son of earth､ what is good,— What then is Yahweh seeking of thee､ But To do justice､ To delight in lovingkindness, And humbly to walk with thy God?
content_old: 8 He hath told thee､ O son of earth､ what is good,— What then is Yahweh seeking of thee､ But To do justice､ To delight in lovingkindness, And humbly to walk with thy God?

content: 9 The voice of Yahweh to the city crieth out, With safety for him who regardeth his name,— Hear ye the rod､ and who hath appointed it.
content_old: 9 The voice of Yahweh to the city crieth out, With safety for him who regardeth his name,— Hear ye the rod､ and who hath appointed it.

content: 10 Even yet are there､ in the house of the lawless one､ the treasures of lawlessness,—and the scant measure—accurst?
content_old: 10 Even yet are there､ in the house of the lawless one､ the treasures of lawlessness,—and the scant measure—accurst?

content: 11 Shall I be pure with lawless balances? Or with a bag of deceitful weights?
content_old: 11 Shall I be pure with lawless balances? Or with a bag of deceitful weights?

content: 12 For her rich men are full of violence, And her inhabitants have spoken falsehood,— And their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
content_old: 12 For her rich men are full of violence, And her inhabitants have spoken falsehood,— And their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

content: 13 Moreover also I have made thee sick with smiting thee,— Laying thee waste because of thy sins.
content_old: 13 Moreover also I have made thee sick with smiting thee,— Laying thee waste because of thy sins.

content: 14 Thou shalt eat— And not be satisfied, But be shrunk with hunger within thee,— Though thou remove､ yet shalt thou not set in safety, And what thou dost set in safety to the sword will I deliver.
content_old: 14 Thou shalt eat— And not be satisfied, But be shrunk with hunger within thee,— Though thou remove､ yet shalt thou not set in safety, And what thou dost set in safety to the sword will I deliver.

content: 15 Thou shalt sow､ but shalt not reap,— Thou shalt tread the olive､ but shalt not anoint thee with oil, Also the grape､ but shalt not drink the wine.
content_old: 15 Thou shalt sow､ but shalt not reap,— Thou shalt tread the olive､ but shalt not anoint thee with oil, Also the grape､ but shalt not drink the wine.

content: 1 Alas for me! for I am become As gatherings of summer fruit, As gleaning-grapes in harvest, There is no cluster to eat, The first ripe fruit my soul craved.
content_old: 1 Alas for me! for I am become As gatherings of summer fruit, As gleaning-grapes in harvest, There is no cluster to eat, The first ripe fruit my soul craved.

content: 2 Perished is the man of lovingkindness out of the earth, And upright among men is there none,— They all for bloodshed lie in wait, Every man—for his brother do they hunt as for one devoted to destruction.
content_old: 2 Perished is the man of lovingkindness out of the earth, And upright among men is there none,— They all for bloodshed lie in wait, Every man—for his brother do they hunt as for one devoted to destruction.

content: 3 Of wickedness with both hands to make sure The ruler doth make demand— And the judge—for a recompense,— And as for the great man he is putting into words the desire of his soul､ So have they woven the net!
content_old: 3 Of wickedness with both hands to make sure The ruler doth make demand— And the judge—for a recompense,— And as for the great man he is putting into words the desire of his soul､ So have they woven the net!

content: 4 The best of them is as a sharp briar, And the most upright worse than a thorn hedge, The day of thy watchmen—of thy visitation hath come, Now shall be their confusion!
content_old: 4 The best of them is as a sharp briar, And the most upright worse than a thorn hedge, The day of thy watchmen—of thy visitation hath come, Now shall be their confusion!

content: 5 Do not trust in a friend, Do not put confidence in an associate,— From her that lieth in thy bosom keep thou the doors of thy mouth;
content_old: 5 Do not trust in a friend, Do not put confidence in an associate,— From her that lieth in thy bosom keep thou the doors of thy mouth;

content: 6 For the son treateth as foolish the father, And the daughter riseth up against her mother､ The daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law,— The foes of a man are the men of his own house.
content_old: 6 For the son treateth as foolish the father, And the daughter riseth up against her mother､ The daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law,— The foes of a man are the men of his own house.

content: 7 But I for Yahweh will watch, I will wait for the God of my salvation,— My God will hear me.
content_old: 7 But I for Yahweh will watch, I will wait for the God of my salvation,— My God will hear me.

content: 8 Do not rejoice､ O mine enemy､ against me, Though I fall I shall rise again! Though I sit in darkness Yahweh is a light to me.
content_old: 8 Do not rejoice､ O mine enemy､ against me, Though I fall I shall rise again! Though I sit in darkness Yahweh is a light to me.

content: 9 The indignation of Yahweh will I bear, For I have sinned against him,— Until he take up my controversy､ Then will he do me justice, He will bring me forth to the light I shall behold his righteousness.
content_old: 9 The indignation of Yahweh will I bear, For I have sinned against him,— Until he take up my controversy､ Then will he do me justice, He will bring me forth to the light I shall behold his righteousness.

content: 10 So shall she who had been mine enemy fear､ And shame shall cover her, Who used to say unto me— Where is Yahweh thy God? Mine own eyes shall look upon her, Now shall she become one to be trodden down､ like the mire of the lanes.
content_old: 10 So shall she who had been mine enemy fear､ And shame shall cover her, Who used to say unto me— Where is Yahweh thy God? Mine own eyes shall look upon her, Now shall she become one to be trodden down､ like the mire of the lanes.

content: 11 On the day for building thy walls— On that day far away shall be thy boundary:
content_old: 11 On the day for building thy walls— On that day far away shall be thy boundary:

content: 12 The very day that against thee shall one come from Assyria､ and from the cities of Egypt; Yea from Egypt､ even unto the River, And from sea to sea､ And from mountain to mountain:
content_old: 12 The very day that against thee shall one come from Assyria､ and from the cities of Egypt; Yea from Egypt､ even unto the River, And from sea to sea､ And from mountain to mountain:

content: 13 Though the land become a desolation､ Because of them that dwell therein,— By reason of the fruit of their doings.
content_old: 13 Though the land become a desolation､ Because of them that dwell therein,— By reason of the fruit of their doings.

content: 14 Shepherd thou thy people with thy rod､ the flock of thine inheritance, Dwell thou alone､ a jungle in the midst of a fruitful field,— Let them feed in Bashan and in Gilead､ As in the days of age-past times.
content_old: 14 Shepherd thou thy people with thy rod､ the flock of thine inheritance, Dwell thou alone､ a jungle in the midst of a fruitful field,— Let them feed in Bashan and in Gilead､ As in the days of age-past times.

content: 15 As in the days of thy coming forth out of the land of Egypt Will I shew him wonders.
content_old: 15 As in the days of thy coming forth out of the land of Egypt Will I shew him wonders.

content: 16 Nations shall see､ that they may turn pale at all their valour,— They shall lay hand on mouth, Their ears shall be silent:
content_old: 16 Nations shall see､ that they may turn pale at all their valour,— They shall lay hand on mouth, Their ears shall be silent:

content: 17 They shall lick the dust like the serpent, Like the crawlers of the earth shall they come quaking out of their fastnesses,— Towards Yahweh our God Shall they pay adoration, And shall fear because of thee.
content_old: 17 They shall lick the dust like the serpent, Like the crawlers of the earth shall they come quaking out of their fastnesses,— Towards Yahweh our God Shall they pay adoration, And shall fear because of thee.

content: 18 Who is a GOD like unto thee､ Taking away the iniquity— And passing over the transgression— Of the remnant of his inheritance? He hath not held fast､ perpetually､ his anger, For One who delighteth in lovingkindness is he!
content_old: 18 Who is a GOD like unto thee､ Taking away the iniquity— And passing over the transgression— Of the remnant of his inheritance? He hath not held fast､ perpetually､ his anger, For One who delighteth in lovingkindness is he!

content: 19 He will again have compassion upon us, He will subdue our iniquities,— Thou wilt cast—into the depths of the sea—all their sins.
content_old: 19 He will again have compassion upon us, He will subdue our iniquities,— Thou wilt cast—into the depths of the sea—all their sins.
